alert.note: Alert for Green; Lafayette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 3:17AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Green and Lafayette. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen tonight and up to 3 inches fell the night before. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroe, Brodhead, Darlington, Shullsburg, Benton, Wiota, New Diggings, South Wayne, Browntown, Gratiot, Woodford, Jordan Center, Juda and Lead Mine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. If you encounter water over the road, turn around.
